column4: then it's almost certainly either a bad download or a bad burn
I've tried every single version of Ubuntu since 5.04
and other distros work fine
that's extremely odd.  One thing I always tell people is never to buy from Dell, for just this sort of reason.  Not just with linux, there is _always_ a problem with a Dell
are the successful ones and this one burned in the same burner by the same program?
It works fine on my Dell. This is an emachines
I don't like them either  :)
that's the machine that blows hot air _at_ the processor instead of away from it.  :)
This particular CD was burnt with k3b. I've also tried ones from shipit and windows
what I'm asking is whether it is manufactured CDs that work and, possibly, burned ones that do not
I have seen that happen with certain hardware
Which is why I am trying Smart Boot Manager now...
ok
But now its just throwing an error
sounds like you've already tried all the obvious things, but, you know, we don't know that until we ask
what's the error?
I'm getting the error "Disk error! 0xAA" when I select CD0
this is some kind of hardware issue.  Make sure you don't have an IDE drive hooked up like an EIDE drive.
make sure you don't have a CS jumper and a master or slave jumper on the same IDE cable
Well, this drive can't burn CD's anymore
I will check out the setup. If nothing else I can find another drive to swap it with
I'd replace the drive.  I know that's somewhat illogical, since other CDs boot, but I think it will work.
I'll see what happends :D
yes, that's advisable especially if you have some around
